greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n / (LCM of divisors of n which are <= sqrt(n)).
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If n = p^k for prime p, then a(n) = p^ceiling(k/2).
In particular, a(n) = n if and only if n is prime.
If n = p*q for primes p < q, then a(n) = q. (End)
maple: f:= proc(n) n/ilcm(op(select(t -> t^2 <= n, numtheory:-divisors(n)))) end proc:
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 20 2002
ext: Corrected and extended by _Matthew Conroy_, Sep 09 2002
